import React from 'react' // import * as BooksAPI from './BooksAPI' import './App.css'; //import Router packages import { BrowserRouter, Route } from 'react-router-dom'; // Let me import my External Components import Checks from './components/checking'; import Search from './components/searching'; import CReading from './components/CurrentlyReading'; import WTRead from './components/WantToRead'; import Read from './components/read'; class BooksApp extends React.Component { state = { /** * TODO: Instead of using this state variable to keep track of which page * we're on, use the URL in the browser's address bar. This will ensure that * users can use the browser's back and forward buttons to navigate between * pages, as well as provide a good URL they can bookmark and share. */ searched: [], all_books: [ {reads: [{title:"The Hobbit", author:"J.R.R. Tolkien"}, {title:"Oh, the Places You'll Go!", author:"Seuss"}, {title:"The Adventures of Tom Sawyer", author:"Mark Twain"}], current_read:[{title: "To Kill a Mockingbird", author: "Harper Lee"}, {title: "Ender's Game", author: "Orson Scott Card"}], want_read: [{title: "1776", author: "David McCullough"}, {title: "Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone", author: "J.K. Rowling"}] }], check: "", pages: "/" } render() { return (

{this.state.check}

this.setState({check: e.target.value})}/>

this.setState({pages:"/"})} />

MyReads
) } } export default BooksApp
